THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON
10.01.2020, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING:

2020/KER/1339
Crl.MC 8177/2019
2
ASHOK MENON, J.
— ¢rl.MC No.8177 of 2019
pated this the 10% day of January, 2020
ORDER

Petitioner is the fourth accused in Crime
No.393/2010 of Pazhayangadi Police Station for having
allegedly committed offences punishable under Sections
143, 147, 148, 341, 323, 324 and 506Cii) read with
Section 149 IPC along with other accused. It is
submitted that the third accused died and the case
against him abated. The rest of the accused faced
trial in CC No.862/2010 on the files of the Judicial
First Class Magistrate's Court, Payyannur for the said
offence and they were all found not guilty = and
acquitted vide judgment dated 6.5.2015 at Annexure-II,
in which it 1s stated that the injured/witnesses did
not identify their assailants. The judgment has since
become final. The case against the petitioner has been
split up and is presently pending as CC No.465/2015 on
the files of the Judicial First Class Magistrate's
Court, Payyannur. No purpose whatsoever would be

2020/KER/1339
Crl.MC 8177/2019
3
served by proceeding with the trial as against the
petitioner, which would only amount to exercise in
Futility.

In the result, the Criminal M.cC. is allowed and
the entire proceedings as against the petitioner herein
in cc No.465/2015 on the files of the Judicial First
Class Magistrate's Court, Payyannur shall stand quashed

ORDER

Petitioner is the fourth accused in Crime
No.393/2010 of Pazhayangadi Police Station for having
allegedly committed offences punishable under Sections
143, 147, 148, 341, 323, 324 and 506Cii) read with
Section 149 IPC along with other accused. It is
submitted that the third accused died and the case
against him abated. The rest of the accused faced
trial in CC No.862/2010 on the files of the Judicial
First Class Magistrate's Court, Payyannur for the said
offence and they were all found not guilty = and
acquitted vide judgment dated 6.5.2015 at Annexure-II,
in which it 1s stated that the injured/witnesses did
not identify their assailants. The judgment has since
become final. The case against the petitioner has been
split up and is presently pending as CC No.465/2015 on
the files of the Judicial First Class Magistrate's
Court, Payyannur. No purpose whatsoever would be

2020/KER/1339
Crl.MC 8177/2019
3
served by proceeding with the trial as against the
petitioner, which would only amount to exercise in
Futility.

In the result, the Criminal M.cC. is allowed and
the entire proceedings as against the petitioner herein
in cc No.465/2015 on the files of the Judicial First
Class Magistrate's Court, Payyannur shall stand quashed
under Section 482 cr.PC and the petitioner/accused is
discharged.
